subject: RE: [junit] A trouble to run Junit.
msgSnippet: the jar contains the junit.ui.TestRunner   If you have the jar, you have it too. BTW, junit.ui.TestRunner is deprecated.  Use junit.awtui.TestRunner, or one of
messageBody:
the jar contains the junit.ui.TestRunner If you have the jar, you have it
too.

BTW, junit.ui.TestRunner is deprecated. Use junit.awtui.TestRunner, or one
of the other 2.

Michael Finney
Sun Certified Programmer for the Java 2 Platform
Sun Certified Developer for the Java 2 Platform

> Hi, everyone,
>
> This's the first time for me to use Junit, because I need to use it
> for my project. But I met a problem, when I download Junit3.5 form
> <http://www.junit.org,> and set my class path to be:
> set CLASSPATH=c:\install-dir\junit\junit.jar;%CLASSPATH%
> after that, I'm wonder whether I need to set classpath for
> junit.textui.TestRunner (or junit.ui.TestRunner) or not. If I need to
> set the classpath, how to set them? Can anyone help me? Thanks a lot
>
